title: I am Artemis: Dave Reynolds
summary: As booster manager for NASA’s SLS (Space Launch System), Dave Reynolds’ path to NASA is embodied by his childhood poster of the space shuttle’s Return to Flight initiative, which hangs in his office, serving as a constant reminder that his journey to the agency began decades ago. title: NASA chief reviews Orion heat shield, expresses “full confidence” in it for Artemis II
summary: "That level of openness and transparency is exactly what should be expected of NASA."

title: NASA’s Pandora Satellite, CubeSats to Explore Exoplanets, Beyond
summary: A new NASA spacecraft called Pandora is awaiting launch ahead of its journey to study the atmospheres of exoplanets, or worlds beyond our solar system, and their stars. Along for the ride are two shoebox-sized satellites called BlackCAT (Black Hole Coded Aperture Telescope) and SPARCS (Star-Planet Activity Research CubeSat), as NASA innovates with ambitious science […]

title: The Space Force will acquire and integrate systems faster in 2026
summary:
At the beginning of 2026, it’s worth reflecting on the U.S. Space Force’s recent accomplishments. They include the creation of the Commercial Space Office and its Commercial Augmentation Space Reserve, a working capital fund to provide flexibility in providing MILSATCOM services and new acquisition approaches for Resilient GPS and Protected Tactical SATCOM. title: Tiangong science program delivers data surge
summary:
Tokyo, Japan (SPX) Jan 09, 2026


Chinese astronauts and ground-based science teams completed 86 new scientific and technological tasks on the Tiangong space station in 2025, underscoring the outpost's expanding role in research, according to the China Manned Space Agency.

title: China tallies record launch year as lunar and asteroid plans advance
summary:
Tokyo, Japan (SPX) Jan 09, 2026


China's space sector completed 93 orbital launch missions in 2025, the highest annual total the nation has recorded.

title: Trimble positioning tech to enhance Lucid Gravity lane level navigation
summary:
Los Angeles CA (SPX) Jan 07, 2026


Trimble has agreed to provide positioning technology that will feed navigation and driver assistance systems in the Lucid Gravity electric vehicle, delivering centimeter-level accuracy in conditions where conventional GPS often loses reliability, such as tunnels, parking structures and dense urban corridors.

title: International Space Station crew to return early after astronaut medical issue
summary:
Washington, United States (AFP) Jan 8, 2026


 NASA crewmembers at the International Space Station will return to Earth within days after an astronaut suffered a health issue, the US space agency said Thursday, the first such medical evacuation in the orbital lab's history. 

Officials did not provide details of the medical event but said the unidentified crewmember is stable. They said it did not result from any kind of injury onboard or

title: Barred spiral galaxy spotted 11.5 billion years in the past
summary:
Los Angeles CA (SPX) Jan 09, 2026


Research led by Daniel Ivanov, a physics and astronomy graduate student in the Kenneth P. Dietrich School of Arts and Sciences at the University of Pittsburgh, has identified a contender for one of the earliest known spiral galaxies containing a stellar bar, a structure that plays a role in how galaxies evolve.
